CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . She is the owner of an apartment in GPE , which she had let to PERSON
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the applicant communicated her intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Naples Magistrate .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Naples Magistrate did not uphold the validity of the notice to quit and declined jurisdiction on account of the value of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant resumed the proceedings before ORG . In a judgment of DATE , deposited with the registry on CARDINAL DATE , the court declared that the lease would terminate on CARDINAL DATE and ordered that the LOC be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that she urgently required the premises as accommodation for her daughter .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession .
CARDINAL . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . Thereafter , the applicant decided not to pursue the enforcement proceedings , in order to avoid useless costs , given the lack of prospects of obtaining the assistance of the police .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served again notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she served notice on the tenant informing him that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . Between DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenant vacated the premises .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
